0.title: Hardik is the most valuable T20 cricketer in world cricket right now: Hogg
0.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya is the "most valuable T20 cricketer in the world right now". "Hardik should be captain of [India's] T20 team in front of Rahul...He proved his worth in the IPL," added Hogg. Hardik scored unbeaten 31 off 12 balls in the first T20I against South Africa.

1.title: BJP clarified respecting all religions is its priority: UP minister on Prophet remarks
1.article_body: Amid the ongoing violence over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the party’s action clarified that respecting all religions is its priority. "Our party and our government believe in unity and respect of all religions. They are going to work together with all parties," he added. "We should talk about peace," Ansari stated.

2.title: 25-year-old law student who hit biker & ran away in Delhi gets bail
2.article_body: The driver of a Mahindra Scorpio who hit a biker and ran away following a verbal altercation near South Delhi's Arjan Garh has been granted bail by a Delhi court. Anuj Chaudhary, a 25-year-old law student, was arrested a day after the incident's video went viral on social media. Chaudhary was granted bail as the biker hadn't sustained serious injuries.

3.title: IIT-B study recommends measures to prevent railway line flooding in Mumbai
3.article_body: IIT Bombay has come up with a study where it has suggested measures to prevent water flooding, especially on Mumbai's railway tracks during monsoon. The study has recommended sewer systems and underground water holding ponds to prevent flooding. Notably, the mitigation assessment was conducted in Dadar, Lower Parel and Kurla areas of the city to understand the issue.

4.title: You can't say opener can't bat in different roles: Shan on Babar Azam's comment
4.article_body: Reacting to captain Babar Azam's remarks that he's a top-order batter and it would be "unfair" to play him in the middle-order in ODIs, Pakistan batter Shan Masood said, "An opener plays cricket in all phases." He added, "You can't say [opener] doesn't know how to bat in different roles." Shan wasn't included in their squad for West Indies ODIs.

5.title: Congress is making huge drama: BJP on Rahul, Sonia's ED summons
5.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra on Sunday accused Congress of making a "huge drama" about Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's respective summons to Enforcement Directorate (ED) with regard to National Herald Case. "Present yourself in front of ED and accept the wrongdoing...Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," Patra said. Rahul Gandhi is slated to appear before the ED tomorrow.

6.title: Don't know if we can keep our bathrooms open to non-customers: Starbucks CEO
6.article_body: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz recently said the company is considering ending its open bathroom policy. Citing safety concerns, he said the coffee giant might no longer allow people who are not customers to use their stores' bathrooms. "We have to harden our stores and provide safety for our people...I don't know if we can keep our bathrooms open," Schultz added.

7.title: Chhetri, Samad's goals give India win over Afg by 2-1 in AFC qualifiers
7.article_body: India defeated Afghanistan by 2-1 in the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers in Kolkata on Saturday. The two goals for India were scored by skipper Sunil Chhetri and midfielder Sahal Abdul Samad. At the end of 90 minutes, the scoreline was 1-1 before Samad scored a goal in the extra time. Notably, India will play against Hong Kong on June 14.

8.title: 5-yr-old boy out for walk with sister in Maha attacked by dogs, dies
8.article_body: A five-year-old boy, who had stepped out of his home for a walk with his sister in Maharashtra's Nagpur, was attacked and killed by stray dogs, reports said. Reports added that while the boy's sister tried to shoo the dogs away, they dragged him to a construction site, where he was mauled to death.

9.title: 3 die due to heat at religious festival in Bengal, CM condoles deaths
9.article_body: Three devotees died due to heat and humidity during the 'Danda Mahotsav' at the ISKCON temple in West Bengal's Panihati. North 24 Parganas District Magistrate said the situation is under control. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee condoled the deaths and said that all help is being provided to people on the spot.

10.title: Villagers in Thane oppose acquisition of land for Mumbai Metro carshed
10.article_body: Villagers from Thane's Bhayander region have opposed acquisition of their cultivable lands for construction of Mumbai Metro Line 9's carshed. About 300 property owners and their kin will be affected by the acquisition, said Bhumiputra Samajik Samanvay Sanstha President Ashok Patil. Government authorities want to acquire villagers' land instead of a privately held plot in the vicinity, Patil said.

11.title: Britain's Queen Elizabeth becomes world's 2nd-longest ruling monarch
11.article_body: Britain's 96-year-old Queen Elizabeth II on Sunday overtook Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej to become the world's second-longest reigning monarch in history. The UK has been celebrating the Queen's Platinum Jubilee to mark 70 years since her coronation in 1953. France's Louis XIV remains the longest-ruling monarch with a 72-year reign from 1643 to 1715.

12.title: How much did the previous IPL media rights cost?
12.article_body: Sony Pictures Networks India had held the media rights for the first 10 years of IPL (2008 to 2017), for which it paid about ₹8,200 crore. Star India had won the IPL media rights for 2018 to 2022 cycle for ₹16,347 crore. The BCCI has set the reserve price at ₹32,890 crore for the 2023-27 cycle of the IPL.

13.title: Address being shared, family has threat from Islamic fundamentalists: Naveen
13.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party's leader Naveen Jindal who was expelled after his remarks on Prophet, took to Twitter to say his family faces threat from Islamic fundamentalists. "It is my humble request to everyone...do not share any kind of information about me and my family members with anyone...many people are posting my residence address on social media," the tweet read.

14.title: Video shows reversing car running over a 2-yr-old twice in TN; boy survives
14.article_body: A two-year-old boy has survived after being run over by a reversing car twice within seconds near Tamil Nadu's Rasipuram on Saturday. A video of the incident shows the boy playing on the street at the time of the incident. Police said the boy suffered fractures and his intestine was damaged in the incident.

15.title: Got scared after watching Big Brother, thought I'll be eliminated: Shilpa
15.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty, who participated in 'Big Brother', said that she initially got scared about the show. "I saw a couple of episodes and I got scared with what I saw. I said, 'I am not going to do all of this'," she added. "I honestly felt like I'll go, and I'll get eliminated in the second week," Shilpa said.

16.title: Rural development began when PM Modi came to power in 2014, says Shah
16.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah said the aspect of rural development is to make villages convenient. "Gandhi Ji had said country’s soul resides in villages. Thus, if you’ve to make this country complete and independent, you’ll have to do it for the villages. This (rural development) began when PM Modi came to power in 2014," Shah added.

17.title: MP milkman, wife kill son, die by suicide; daughter survives incident
17.article_body: A milkman and his wife killed their son in Madhya Pradesh before also killing themselves. Reports said that they also tried to kill their daughter who survived the incident. The man's brother said that he was in distress due to abetment of suicide case on him and other members of the family.

18.title: NCB seizes 4.8 kg of charas from water purifier in Mumbai, 2 held
18.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in Mumbai has seized 4.88 kg of charas concealed in a special cavity made inside a water purifier, an official said on Sunday. The water purifier was to be sent to Australia through a courier service, the official added. The NCB has apprehended the consignor and a courier agent on Saturday, the official further said.

19.title: Exxon made more money than God this year: US President amid high oil prices
19.article_body: US President Joe Biden accused the US oil industry and Exxon Mobil of capitalising on high oil and gas prices as inflation soared to a 40-year high in the country. He said, "Exxon made more money than God this year." He added that US oil companies are not using higher profits to drill more but to buy back stocks.

20.title: Fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis: BJP's Sambit Patra ahead of Rahul's ED date
20.article_body: A day before Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is scheduled to appear before ED, BJP's Sambit Patra said Congress is making "a huge drama" out of it. "Why this drama of press conferences…What is this Satyagrah? Gandhiji would be shamed to see this fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis," Patra added. "Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," he stated.

21.title: PM to inaugurate Sant Tukaram temple in Pune, security tightened
21.article_body: Security has been tightened for PM Narendra Modi's visit to Pune on June 14, during which he will inaugurate the Sant Tukaram temple. The entry of the devotees into the Sant Tukaram temple will be allowed in a restricted manner on Sunday and Monday and it will be barred on Tuesday, the trustees said.

22.title: Ruturaj's strike rate in first 10 balls is very low, that's a problem: Aakash
22.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said Ruturaj Gaikwad's strike rate at the start of his innings is a "problem" for India in the T20Is against South Africa. "Gaikwad goes at a strike rate of 80-90 in the first 10-12 balls. After that, if he plays a big knock then fine, else he pegs you back a little bit," explained Aakash.

23.title: Hyd Police arrest 3 for cheating people of ₹8 cr in govt scheme scam
23.article_body: Hyderabad's Ghatkesar Police along with Malkajgiri Special Operations team (SOT) have arrested three persons who were absconding in a cheating case. The accused would reportedly target people belonging to SC, ST and OBC communities, for whom government has introduced various welfare schemes. The accused had allegedly collected ₹8 crore from people in guise of 'deposits' for the beneficiary amount.

24.title: High time PM breaks silence on rising Islamophobic cases: Tharoor
24.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said it is high time PM Narendra Modi breaks his silence on the proliferation of Islamophobic incidents in the country. Tharoor's comments came following controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by two BJP leaders. "I think our current hate speech laws and Section 295A are quite adequate to deal with such misbehaviour," Tharoor said.

25.title: $5 trillion GDP goal appears to be case of shifting goalposts: Chidambaram
25.article_body: Former Union Minister and Congress leader P Chidambaram said that the BJP-led Centre's "goal of a $5 trillion GDP appears to be a case of shifting goalposts". "The original target year was 2023-24...We are nowhere near that goalpost," Chidambaram said. He added, "Now, the Chief Economic Adviser has said we will achieve the goal by 2027."

26.title: Chhattisgarh BJP leader booked over alleged 'fake' coal theft video
26.article_body: Chhattisgarh BJP Secretary Om Prakash Choudhary was booked on Saturday following a complaint alleging that the coal theft video he posted was "fake". The purported video, which went viral, showed people digging and carrying away coal from an opencast coal mine in Korba. The District Collector had "accepted that coal theft was going on", Choudhary said reacting to the FIR.

27.title: France holds first round of parliamentary elections on Sunday
27.article_body: The first round of the parliamentary elections is taking place in France on Sunday. President Emmanuel Macron, who recently won the presidential election, is seeking a majority for his coalition in the National Assembly. More than 6,000 candidates are in fray for 577 seats in the National Assembly. The second and final round will be held on June 19.

28.title: Top 10 most valued firms lose ₹2.29 lakh cr in m-cap in past week
28.article_body: The top 10 most valued firms lost ₹2.29 lakh crore in market capitalisation (m-cap) in the past week, with LIC taking the biggest hit after losing ₹57,272.85 crore in m-cap. LIC was followed by Reliance Industries, which witnessed a fall in m-cap of ₹44,311.19 crore, and Hindustan Unilever Limited, losing ₹21,674.98 crore in m-cap. Reliance remains India's most valued firm.

29.title: 22 injured as missiles hit military facility in Ukraine: Governor
29.article_body: As many as 22 people were injured after missiles destroyed a military facility in Ukraine's Chortkiv, said Volodymyr Trush, Governor of the Ternopil region, on Sunday. "All missiles were from the Black Sea. A military facility and civilian facilities were partially destroyed," he said. Four apartment buildings had been damaged in the attack, he added.

30.title: Thousands of sheep drown as overladen ship sinks off Sudan's coast
30.article_body: An overladen ship crammed with thousands of sheep capsized on Sunday off Sudan's Red Sea coast drowning the animals on board but with all crew surviving, port officials said. The livestock vessel was heading from Sudan's port of Suakin to Saudi Arabia. "It was carrying 15,800 sheep, which was beyond its load limits," an official said.

31.title: Combined bid for IPL TV and digital rights crosses ₹40,000-crore mark: Reports
31.article_body: The combined bid for IPL TV and digital rights has crossed the ₹40,000-crore mark, as per reports. With this, the media rights value of the league has more than doubled as compared to 2018-2022 media rights value that was won by Star India for ₹16,347 crore for TV and digital rights. The winners will be announced on Monday.

32.title: Heatwave to reduce in 4 states/UTs; IMD releases list
32.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted that heatwave conditions will continue in isolated pockets over Punjab, Haryana, Delhi and southeast Uttar Pradesh during next two days, but will reduce after that. Heatwave conditions are also likely over east Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand on June 12 and 13 and in Jammu division on June 12.

33.title: Chhattisgarh boy stuck in borewell for over 45 hrs, rescue op underway
33.article_body: The rescue operation is underway to get an 11-year-old boy out of a borewell in Chhattisgarh even after over 45 hours. The boy is conscious, officials said. The boy fell into the 80-feet-deep abandoned borewell in the backyard of his house in the Janjgir-Champa district of the state on Friday.

34.title: India beat Olympic champions Belgium in shootout at Men's Pro Hockey League
34.article_body: Goalkeeper PR Sreejesh saved a penalty stroke in the shootout as India defeated Olympic champions Belgium 5-4 in first match of the two-legged FIH Men's Pro Hockey League on Saturday. India were down 1-3 with just eight minutes left in the match but held Belgium 3-3 to force a penalty shootout. Sreejesh was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

35.title: Govt setting up communication with minorities to hear their problems: UP minister
35.article_body: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the state government is starting 'Qaumi Chaupals' in the state to set up communication with the minorities and hear their problems. "Started 'Qaumi Chaupal' to create awareness about schemes for minorities on the ground level," Ansari added. "We're setting up communication with them so we may also hear their problems," he stated.

36.title: BMC tells residents to take precautions amid rising malaria cases
36.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has asked residents to take precautions against malaria amid a rise in cases in Mumbai. In the first five days of June, the city has reported 57 cases of malaria and 10 cases of dengue. Notably, the city had reported 950 malaria cases and 94 dengue cases until June 5 this year.

37.title: You took it personally to heart: Moeen to Cook over viral on-air clash in January
37.article_body: Referring to their on-air clash that went viral in January, Moeen Ali told Alastair Cook, "You took it personally to heart." Moeen said, "I was basically saying that Joe Root had a lot more empathy for players than you did and I never mentioned once that you're not a good captain or if you are or aren't better than Root."

38.title: IPL generates more revenue than English Premier League: Sourav Ganguly
38.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly, in a recent event, said that IPL generates more revenue than English Premier League. "I’ve seen the game evolve...where players like me earned a few hundreds and now have the potential of earning crores," Ganguly said. He added, "It makes me feel happy and proud that the sport I love has evolved to become so strong."

39.title: IAS officer scolded by HC judge over dress code, asked 'Is this a cinema hall?'
39.article_body: A video showing a Bihar IAS officer being scolded by a Patna High Court judge during a court hearing has been widely shared online. "You don't know in what dress code you've to appear in the court?...Do you think this is a cinema hall?" Justice PB Bajanthri is heard asking Bihar Principal Secretary for Housing and Urban Development Anand Kishor.

40.title: 295 Maoist sympathisers, militias surrender in Odisha: Police
40.article_body: The Odisha Police said 295 active Maoist militias, Maoist sympathisers, members of the local village committee and members of the Maoist frontal organisations surrendered before police in Malkangiri. "The villagers who surrendered were involved in several exchanges of fire, arson cases, civilian killings, hoisting of black flags instead of national flag and burning of vehicles," an official said.

41.title: Illegal liquor vend busted in Gurugram, 1 arrested
41.article_body: An illegal liquor vend was busted in Gurugram and one person was arrested, police said on Saturday. The excise department and the Chief Minister's flying squad, acting on a tip-off, conducted a joint raid and seized a large quantity of liquor, police added. An FIR has been registered against the owners at Manesar Police Station, they added.

42.title: PM's silence is baffling: Chidambaram on ex-BJP leaders' Prophet remarks
42.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticised PM Narendra Modi over the alleged remarks against Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders, saying, "The PM's silence is baffling, but in tune with his silence on past occasions." Moreover, on being questioned about foreign countries condemning the remarks, he replied that the PM should have "spoken and acted immediately after the offensive utterances".

43.title: Noida authority razes 27 farmhouses built on Yamuna floodplains
43.article_body: Noida authority on Saturday demolished 27 farmhouses built illegally in an area of 15 hectares on the Yamuna floodplains, officials said. The land is worth around ₹60 crore and is located in villages like Nagla Nagli and Nagli Wajidpur in Sector 135, they added. More such illegal constructions will be razed soon, said Noida authority's OSD (Land) Prasun Dwivedi.

44.title: India should play first 3 T20Is vs SA with same team: Ashish Nehra
44.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Ashish Nehra said Team India should play with the same playing XI in the first three T20Is against South Africa unless there is a "drastic change" in conditions. He stated Cuttack also has a high-scoring pitch. "India should learn from the defeat in the first game and move to the second one without panicking much," Nehra stated.

45.title: 5 killed after truck hits car, bike in Rajasthan's Jhalawar
45.article_body: Five people were killed and two got injured after a container truck collided with a car and a bike near Akodia village of Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. The truck collided with the car first and then hit the bike-borne three youths 50 metres ahead, police said. Out of the five deceased, three on bike were college students aged between 20-22 years.

46.title: BJP MLA shares video of police beating 9 men with sticks in UP, calls it 'return gift'
46.article_body: After protests over ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks, BJP MLA Shalabh Mani Tripathi has shared a video of police beating up nine men with sticks and wrote, "Return gift for rioters." The video shows the men crying in pain as police beat them in what seems to be a police station. Meanwhile, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav condemned the act.

47.title: 7 govt doctors put on duty to treat DM's sick cow in UP's Fatehpur
47.article_body: The Chief Veterinary Officer of Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur, Dr SK Tiwari, has directed seven veterinary doctors to treat the ailing cow of District Magistrate Apurva Dubey. In an official letter, the officer has directed the doctors to check the cow daily in the morning and in the evening. The order also mentions that any laxity will be unpardonable.

48.title: Ex-world no. 1 Murray reaches 1st final on grass in 6 years at Boss Open
48.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray defeated Nick Kyrgios 7-6(7-5), 6-2 at the Boss Open in Stuttgart to enter his first tour-level final on grass in six years. The Brit won his semi-final in one hour 31 minutes. Unseeded Murray will face second-seeded Matteo Berrettini, who beat German Oscar Otte 7-6(9-7), 7-6(7-5), in the final on Sunday.

49.title: Will get into the mind of Dhoni if I get mind reading power: Karthik
49.article_body: During an interaction for BCCI, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he would get into the mind of ex-India captain MS Dhoni if he gets the ability to read minds. On being asked to choose between Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, Karthik said, "Messi, I think he is slightly different and I enjoy watching him in the little that I have watched."

50.title: I enjoy intimacy, don't have to keep it a secret at my age: Imtiaz on 'She'
50.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali, while speaking about turning intimacy director for his upcoming series 'She', said that like every Indian, he enjoys intimacy. "I am at an age where I don't have to keep my interest in intimacy a secret," Imtiaz added. He also said that there is a lot of potential dramatically in intimacy.

51.title: Hyd Police nab 3 interstate drug traffickers; seize MDMA, cocaine
51.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested three drug traffickers on the outskirts of Choutuppal and seized narcotic substances, including cocaine and MDMA pills, and ₹60,000 cash from them. The accused, who are part of an interstate drug syndicate supplying contraband substances from Goa to Andhra Pradesh, were caught following a tip-off. One of the accused is yet to be arrested.

52.title: Foreign investors withdraw net ₹14,000 crore in 8 days in June
52.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have withdrawn ₹14,000 crore from Indian equity markets in eight trading sessions in June. With this, the total net outflow by FPIs so far this year has reached ₹1.81 lakh crore, data with depositories showed. FPIs sold net ₹40,000 crore from Indian equity markets in May, ₹17,144 crore in April and ₹41,123 crore in March.

53.title: Shraddha's makeup artist gets injured on sets of Luv Ranjan's film in Spain
53.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor’s makeup artist, Shraddha Naik, injured her leg on sets of Luv Ranjan’s film in Spain. Taking to Instagram, Naik shared a video from the shoot and revealed that she suffered a ligament tear and was put in a cast for 10 days. Alongside it, she wrote, "They said 'Break a leg in Spain' I took it seriously."

54.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' extended cut to release in US on Sept 2
54.article_body: Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' extended cut will receive a theatrical release in US and Canada on September 2. The film's official Twitter handle announced, "Spider-Man: No Way Home: The More Fun Stuff Version swings into movie theatres in the US...Canada September 2! More countries to be announced soon!" The film also features Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield.

55.title: Each one of us has a role to play to end child labour: Ayushmann
55.article_body: On World Day Against Child Labour, actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said, "Each one of us has a role to play to end child labour." Ayushmann is UNICEF's celebrity advocate for the Ending Violence Against Children campaign. "Children belong in schools and playgrounds, not workshops, factories, agricultural fields or as domestic labourers," he added.

56.title: Ex-Barcelona footballer Prince marries Italian model on Moon in metaverse, pics surface
56.article_body: Former Barcelona footballer Kevin Prince Boateng, commonly known as Prince, married Italian model Valentina Fradegrada on Moon in the metaverse. "I wanted to do something special for Valentina, something that nobody had ever done. Thanks to OVER, we can celebrate our love like no one has done before, in a space location," Prince had earlier said.

57.title: US-based electric scooter startup fires 23% of its employees
57.article_body: US-based electric scooter startup Bird has fired 23% of its employees. Bird reportedly told a website that it has a headcount of about 600 people, meaning almost 140 employees will be affected. The layoffs will range from senior managers to new hires, said a Bird spokesperson. In 2020, Bird had fired 30% of its workforce on a Zoom call.

58.title: Chemical thrown on woman allegedly raped by Raj minister's son, told to drop case: DCW
58.article_body: The 23-year-old woman who had accused Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi's son of rape in Jaipur and Delhi was attacked with a chemical by some "unidentified persons", the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) told police. "They...threatened her to withdraw her rape case," said DCW. The woman alleged that the accused persons told her 'This is just a trailer', during the attack.

59.title: Names, addresses asked before killing, how to live safely: Kashmiri Pandit
59.article_body:
While talking about the recent killings in Kashmir, a Kashmiri Pandit, as quoted by The Quint, said,
"We have seen minority killings earlier too, but this time, militancy has taken the form of targeted killings. They ask for names and addresses before killing. How can we live safely there?" He added he fears to be killed while sitting in office.

60.title: Binny Bansal sells 0.72% stake in Flipkart worth ₹2,060 crore to Tencent: Report
60.article_body: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal has sold a 0.72% stake in Flipkart to China-based tech conglomerate Tencent through its European subsidiary, PTI reported citing official documents. The stake is valued at $264 million (over ₹2,060 crore) as per Flipkart's last valuation of $37.6 billion. The transaction was reportedly completed last year, and disclosed to the government in current financial year.

61.title: BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron detected in 37-year-old man in Pune
61.article_body: A 37-year-old man from Pune has tested positive for BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron. The man has been fully vaccinated and he returned from England on May 21. "The patient, who had mild symptoms, was diagnosed with COVID-19 on June 2 and cured after being in home isolation," Maharashtra surveillance officer Dr Pradeep Awate has said.

62.title: Man going to Golden Temple with family shot dead in Amritsar
62.article_body: A man was allegedly shot dead in Punjab's Amritsar on Sunday while he was going to visit the Golden Temple with his wife and two children. The victim, identified as Harinder Singh, had returned from Dubai, where he worked, just five days ago. His wife said that the attackers tried to snatch their valuables which led to a scuffle.

63.title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised in Delhi over COVID-related issues
63.article_body: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has been admitted to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi due to issues related to COVID-19, party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "She's stable and will be kept at the hospital for observation," he added. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate had issued fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23.

64.title: Crypto market value declines to $1.1 trillion as Bitcoin drops to $27,000 level
64.article_body: The value of global crypto market declined more than 8% to $1.1 trillion as major cryptocurrencies traded in the red on Sunday. Bitcoin, the largest crypto by market value, fell 6.29% to $27,454, whereas Ethereum plunged as low as $1,450, its lowest level since March 2021. The decline comes after US inflation hit a 40-year high of 8.6% in May.

65.title: Hardik can score 70-80 in 30 balls, send him ahead of Pant: Chopra
65.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that all-rounder Hardik Pandya has the ability to score 70-80 runs off 30 deliveries. "I feel you should send Hardik...whenever a wicket falls after the 10th-12th over," Chopra said. "If you give Hardik 30 balls...he is going to give you a 70 or 80...You can send him ahead of Rishabh Pant," Chopra added.

66.title: It's just unbelievable what Rafael Nadal has achieved: Roger Federer
66.article_body: Tennis player Roger Federer praised Rafael Nadal after the latter won the 14th French Open title.  "It's just unbelievable what Rafa has achieved. The record of Pete Sampras, which I beat, was 14 Grand Slam titles. Now Rafa has won the French Open 14 times," Federer stated. "I was happy for him that he did it again," he added.

67.title: Philippine Defense Secretary faints during Independence Day event
67.article_body: Philippine Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana on Sunday morning fainted during an Independence Day ceremony at Rizal Park. He later shared a picture of himself at a hospital saying, "My lack of rest and sleep from my recent...international security engagements may have taken its toll...I'm fine now." Delfin was advised to rest following the incident, Defense spokesperson Arsenio Andolong said.

68.title: Stuart Broad shares pic of major fire at his pub, says 'Not sure I still can believe it'
68.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to Instagram to share picture of major fire at his pub. He wrote, "I couldn’t believe the news...Not sure I still can." He added, "Thankfully no one was hurt, the Nottinghamshire Fire Service were incredible in their efforts & thank you to the villagers for the wonderful support & sorry for the disruption."

69.title: AAP announces new Gujarat unit, Kishorbhai Desai named state chief
69.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday announced the new office-bearers for its Gujarat unit. Kishorbhai Desai has been named as the State President, while Manoj Sorathiya has been appointed as State General Secretary. The party also appointed Gujarat leader Isudan Gadhvi as the National Joint General Secretary and Indranil Rajguru as the National Joint Secretary.

70.title: Demolition of 'illegally constructed' house of Prayagraj violence accused underway
70.article_body: Demolition of the "illegally constructed" residence of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed is underway. The move came after Prayagraj Development Authority (PDA) earlier put a demolition notice at the residence. News agency ANI reported that heavy security force has been deployed in front of Ahmed's residence. The PDA had asked him to vacate the house by 11 am today.

71.title: That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun Shanaka: Aaron Finch
71.article_body: After Sri Lanka chased down 59 runs in the last three overs in the third T20I, Australia captain Aaron Finch praised Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka's knock. "That was an unbelievable knock by Dasun tonight...I don't think our choice of batting first today had any reason for the defeat," he stated. Dasun smashed 25-ball 54 runs in the match.

72.title: Ready to play for Eng Test side if McCullum wants me in it: Moeen Ali
72.article_body: English all-rounder Moeen Ali has opened up to the idea of coming out of retirement from Test cricket and represent the English Test side. "When, or if, (England head coach) Brendon McCullum wants me, I'll play in Pakistan. I have played Pakistan Super League out there a few years ago," Ali said. Notably, England will tour Pakistan in November-December 2022.

73.title: UP groom leaves mandap for drinking water, runs from wedding over no dowry
73.article_body: A groom who was getting married among 144 couples in a mass-wedding event ran away from the wedding after he did not get dowry he wanted, reports said. Reports added that the groom had left the 'mandap' on pretext of going to drink water. When he did not return, massive search was reportedly initiated but he could not be traced.

74.title: Stop wearing 'I work long hrs, have no time for family' as a badge of honour: Namita
74.article_body: Emcure Pharmaceuticals' Executive Director and Shark Tank India judge Namita Thapar took to Twitter to talk about work-life balance. She wrote, "Stop wearing 'I work long hours, I travel a lot, I have no time for family' as a badge of honour. Let's fix work-life balance at all companies so we have a mentally fit and more productive generation next."

75.title: Hardik extremely versatile, you can play him at no. 4 and no. 6 as well: Bangar
75.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has called all-rounder Hardik Pandya an "extremely versatile" player, who can be used in multiple roles by the team. "Hardik has worked very well on his game's foundation. You can play him at number four and at number six as well," Bangar added. Hardik scored 31*(12) in the first T20I against South Africa.

76.title: Woman attacked with blade for resisting eve-teasing in Bhopal, gets 118 stitches on face
76.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was attacked with a blade for resisting eve-teasing by three men and slapping one of them in Bhopal which led to 118 stitches on her face. The woman's one eye is not opening and she's not even able to speak, police said. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said stringent action will be taken against the accused.

77.title: Rebranded McDonald's outlets open in Russia, renamed 'Vkusno & tochka'
77.article_body: The first 15 rebranded restaurants of former McDonald's reopened in Russia on Sunday under the name 'Vkusno & tochka', which means "Tasty & that's it". The new owner had recently unveiled their logo which featured two french fries and a burger. In May, McDonald's shut its business in Russia after 30 years of operation over the Ukraine war.

78.title: B'luru records 87% rise in new COVID-19 cases in 7 days with 545 cases
78.article_body: The number of new COVID-19 cases recorded in Bengaluru rose by about 87% in the last seven days as 545 new cases were reported on Saturday, according to BBMP data. The city had recorded 291 new cases on June 5. Only one COVID-19 death was recorded during the period and the total active clusters remained above 10, the data showed.

79.title: 'More transmissible' Omicron BA.4 COVID-19 variant detected in Russia
79.article_body: The Omicron BA.4 variant of COVID-19 has been detected in Russia, the country's health watchdog Rospotrebnadzor's genome lab head Kamil Khafizov said. "A number of studies published recently have revealed that variants...BA.4 and BA.5 are a little bit more transmissible than...early forms of Omicron," he said. Currently, BA.2 variant and its sub-variant are dominant in the country, he added.

80.title: Don't want to close door to China, willing to engage: Taiwan
80.article_body: Taiwan Premier Su Tseng-chang has said the country has always had goodwill towards China. "As long as there is equality, reciprocity and no political preconditions, we are willing to engage in goodwill with China," he said. "Taiwan does not want to close the door to China," he added. He blamed China for using "means to oppress and treat Taiwan unreasonably".

81.title: Prominent leader of Shiv Sena to attend Oppn leaders’ meeting: Raut
81.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said a prominent leader of the party will take part in Opposition leaders’ meeting called by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, on June 15, instead of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. The decision comes as the CM will be in Ayodhya at that time, Raut stated. The meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential poll.

82.title: One of the best T20I finishes, that was brutal hitting by Shanaka: Malinga
82.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Lasith Malinga has praised Dasun Shanaka for his unbeaten 54-run innings against Australia in their third T20I in Pallekele. "One of the best T20I finishes I've ever witnessed. That was some brutal hitting [by Shanaka]," tweeted Malinga. Shanaka's knock helped Sri Lanka to chase down 59 runs in the last three overs and win by four wickets.

83.title: Cong, JD(S) have accepted BJP as 'A' team: Karnataka CM
83.article_body: After BJP won three out of four Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka on Friday, CM Basavaraj Bommai has spoken about the opposition parties namely JD(S) and Congress. "We are not bothered as to who is the 'B' team...It means both the opposition parties have accepted that BJP is the 'A' team," CM Bommai said.

84.title: Won't outstay my welcome as England manager: Gareth Southgate
84.article_body: England head coach Gareth Southgate has said that he will not outstay his welcome as the football team's manager. "I think I can do a good job for the team, and...we have done a good job for the team," he stated. Southgate signed a contract extension in November last year and will remain England manager till 2024 end.

85.title: Power supply gets disrupted in Nepal after man climbs onto transmission line
85.article_body: Electricity production in Nepal's Nuwakot's hydro-electric plant was disrupted after a person climbed onto a power transmission line and has been clinging to it. The state electricity authority, Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) was forced to shut down the power project. As per an NEA official, an average loss of around one million Nepalese Rupees has been incurred due to this.

86.title: Death knell for rule of law: Karti after buildings bulldozed in UP
86.article_body: After buildings of those accused of violence during protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur, Congress’ Karti Chidambaram said state-sponsored vigilante justice is the "death knell" for the rule of law. In Kanpur, parts of a building owned by businessman Mohammad Ishtiyaq, a relative of 'key conspirator' Hayat Zafar Hashmi, were demolished.

87.title: I would want South Africa to drop David Miller, jokes Bhuvneshwar Kumar ahead of 2nd T20I
87.article_body: Ahead of the second India-South Africa T20I, pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said, "It is difficult bowling to David Miller." He added, "He is in such good form. I would want South Africa to drop him but they would not do so." Bhuvneshwar stated, "He batted so well in the IPL, we know his calibre. Bowling to him would be a challenge."

88.title: Salman joins Kamal, Chiranjeevi at Vikram success party, pics surface
88.article_body: Pictures of actor Salman Khan with actors Kamal Haasan and Chiranjeevi at the success party of the film 'Vikram' have surfaced on social media. Chiranjeevi took to Twitter and shared the pictures and wrote, "Absolute joy, celebrating and honouring my dearest old friend Kamal for the spectacular success of 'Vikram' along with my dearest Sallu Bhai."

89.title: R Madhavan’s Rocketry trailer launched at Times Square, actor shares video
89.article_body: The trailer of actor R Madhavan's film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' was screened at the NASDAQ Billboard at Times Square in New York. The actor took to Instagram and shared a video of the crowd at Times Square. The film is written, produced and directed by Madhavan, who also plays the lead role.

90.title: Trent Boult equals world record for scoring most runs at no. 11 in Test cricket
90.article_body: New Zealand pacer Trent Boult equalled the world record for scoring the most runs batting at number 11 in Test cricket. With his 16*(18), Boult took his tally of Test runs at number 11 to 623. He equalled former Sri Lanka off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan's record. Boult scored 623 runs in 78 innings, while Muralitharan scored in 98 innings.

91.title: 19 lakh+ devotees undertook Char Dham Yatra since May 3: Temple Committee
91.article_body: The Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee said that since the Char Dham Yatra began on May 3, over 19 lakh devotees have undertaken the journey. Reports said that 6,57,547 pilgrims reached Badrinath Dham From May 8 to June 11 evening, while 6,33,548 pilgrims have reached the Kedarnath Dham from May 6 to June 11 evening.

92.title: India hands over 50-bed hospital in Bokhtar to Tajikistan
92.article_body: India's Ambassador to Tajikistan Viraj Singh on Saturday handed over the 50-bed India-Tajikistan Friendship Hospital (ITFH) in Bokhtar to the Tajik Deputy Defence Minister Major General Shohiyon Abdusottor. The medical equipment, medicines, stores and support equipment were also handed over, a press release said. The ITFH, which was renovated by the Indian government, was inaugurated in 2014.

93.title: Thousands stage protests against gun violence across US
93.article_body: Tens of thousands of people took out rallies across the US demanding a law to curb gun violence in the country. This comes in the wake of a spate of mass shootings across the country including the Texas school shooting incident. A group called March For Our Lives (MFOL) estimated that about 40,000 people assembled in the capital Washington DC.

94.title: Ukraine in control of Luhansk plant sheltering hundreds, claims Guv
94.article_body: Ukraine is in control of a chemical plant in Luhansk's Sievierodonetsk where hundreds of people are sheltering, the region's Governor Serhiy Gaidai claimed. As per Ukraine authorities, about 800 people are hiding there. Moreover, Gaidai said that information about a blockade at the plant is a "lie" after a Russian-backed Luhansk official stated that 300-400 Ukrainian troops were blockaded there.

95.title: AIMIM will contest this year's Gujarat Assembly elections: Owaisi
95.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi announced at a press conference on Saturday that his party will contest in the Gujarat Assembly elections scheduled to be held later this year. "We will fight Gujarat Assembly elections with full strength. However, we haven't decided on how many seats. I believe that Sabir Kabliwala (AIMIM Gujarat chief) will make the right decision," Owaisi said.

96.title: In a world first, Canada proposes to print health warnings on every cigarette
96.article_body: Canada is poised to become the first country in the world to require health warnings to be printed on individual cigarettes. Mental Health and Addictions Minister said the current proposal is "Poison in every puff". The new packaging would help to ensure health-related messages reach people who often access cigarettes one at a time in social situations, the government said.

97.title: Hand grenade found near Delhi-Noida Direct flyway, area cordoned off
97.article_body: A hand grenade was reportedly found near the Delhi-Noida Direct flyway on Saturday. Reports said that youths bathing in the Yamuna informed police about a sack with hand grenade. The whole area was reportedly cordoned off to avoid any untoward incident. "There are a few shops of scrap dealers in the adjoining areas. We are questioning them," an official said.

98.title: Good that people who misuse freedom of speech are sent to jail: Shekhar
98.article_body: Shekhar Suman has said, "People who misuse freedom of speech, it is good that they are sent to jail." He added that people cracking jokes on religion can't get away by saying that it is their freedom of speech. "Freedom comes with responsibility and if you can't take that responsibility then you will have to go to jail," he added.

99.title: Idea is to return to top-level tennis in 2023: Roger Federer
99.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer has said that he is "definitely" planning to return to top-level tennis in 2023. "How and where, I don't know yet. But that would be the idea (to return next year)," Federer told a newspaper. He added, "It's just unbelievable what Rafa has achieved...Now Rafa won the French Open 14 times. That's unbelievable."

100.title: This was small battle, big one still left: Fadnavis on RS poll results
100.article_body: After BJP won three out of six Rajya Sabha seats in Maharashtra, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said this was a small battle, the big one is still left. "We didn’t get afraid even when state government lodged cases against those who supported us," Fadnavis added. "We're very happy that all our three candidates…have been elected to Rajya Sabha," he stated.

101.title: Double-hundred doesn't mean a hell of a lot: Daryl Mitchell on getting out on 190
101.article_body: New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell has said he doesn't regret getting dismissed for 190(318) during their first innings in the second England Test. "A double-hundred personally doesn't mean a hell of a lot...was just nice to contribute to a score that can help us win," he stated. Mitchell and Tom Blundell added 236 runs to help New Zealand post 553 runs.

102.title: Global star rising, you'll have to learn how to spell his name: Mahindra on Praggnanandhaa
102.article_body: After India's 16-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa won the Norway Chess Group A open chess tournament, Anand Mahindra tweeted, "A global star is rising." He added, "You’ll have to learn how to spell his name correctly from now on." Notably, Praggnanandhaa has defeated world champion Magnus Carlsen twice this year.

103.title: In its core, 'Brahmastra Part One' is also love story: Ayan Mukerji
103.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said a love story is there to talk about in his film 'Brahmastra'. "The thing about 'Brahmastra' is that you won't realise right away but I hope you'll take away is...in its core, 'Brahmastra Part One' is also a love story amongst being...other things," he stated. "That's a very natural...nice fit with Ranbir Kapoor...Alia Bhatt," he added.

104.title: 4 arrested by Faridabad Police for assaulting, robbing commuters
104.article_body: Four members of a gang were arrested by the Faridabad Police for allegedly abducting, assaulting and robbing commuters in the city. The accused were arrested from Faridabad's Patel Chowk with the help of a tip-off. The accused had already robbed several commuters of ₹10 lakh, police said. The accused were identified as Vikas Kumar, Gajraj, Vishal and Vicky.

105.title: Apple to shift some iPad production units from China to Vietnam amid COVID-19 norms
105.article_body: After facing supply disruptions due to COVID-19 restrictions, Apple is moving some iPad production units from China to Vietnam. To protect itself from future shortages and supply issues, Apple has reportedly asked multiple component suppliers to build up their inventories. Plans of shifting units to Vietnam were earlier delayed due to a surge in COVID-19 cases in Vietnam.

106.title: BCCI will get paid at least ₹93 crore per IPL match from media rights: Jay Shah
106.article_body: Talking about the e-auction of media rights for IPL for 2023-2027 cycle, BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said, "Going by the present minimum base price that we have set, BCCI will get paid $12 million (nearly ₹93 crore) per IPL match." He added, "That’s a giant leap for Indian cricket on the world stage. We will be just behind NFL."

107.title: It doesn't bother me, I know my truth: Jennifer on link-up rumours with Tanuj
107.article_body: While talking about link-up rumours with her 'Code M' co-star Tanuj Virwani, actress Jennifer Winget said that it does not bother her. "As long as I know my truth, my family knows the truth, my friends and fans know my truth, that's all that matters to me," she added. Winget had earlier spoken about her separation with actor Karan Grover.

108.title: No change in XI required unless wicket is dry: Gambhir on India-SA 2nd T20I
108.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said no change is required in India's playing XI for the second T20I against South Africa unless the wicket is "extremely dry". Gambhir added, "[If the wicket is dry]...you can sit out a seamer and play the leg-spinner in Bishnoi and Hardik can be your third seamer." India lost the first T20I by seven wickets.

109.title: UP CM seems to be presiding over kangaroo court: Mehbooba Mufti
109.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said UP CM Yogi Adityanath seems to be presiding over a "kangaroo court" where minorities are bulldozed on a regular basis. Her statement came after buildings of those accused of violence during recent protests were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur. "Unfortunately, judiciary watches in silence as homes and lives are wrecked," Mufti tweeted.

110.title: 2 more terrorists linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba killed in J&K's Pulwama
110.article_body: Two more terrorists were killed in a counter-terrorism operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama, the police said on Sunday. This comes a day after one terrorist was killed there when the encounter broke out. All the three terrorists are linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba and one of them was involved in the killing of a police officer last month, the police added.

111.title: Hyd's theft racket busted, 53 2-wheelers worth ₹15,20,000 recovered; 3 held
111.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday arrested three people for being involved in a theft racket. Police recovered 53 two-wheelers worth ₹15,20,000 from them. Reports said that the accused stole parked vehicles in the city during the wee hours and sold them in rural areas at lower prices. The accused reportedly told buyers they would receive legal documents of vehicles at earliest.

112.title: Sri Lanka open to buying oil from Russia, says PM Wickremesinghe
112.article_body: Amid the economic crisis, Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said that he is open to buying oil from Russia. He said that the country desperately needs fuel and is currently trying to get oil and coal from suppliers in the Middle East. But if the requirement isn't fulfilled, the country may have to go to Russia again, he added.

113.title: Kerala gold smuggling accused collapses before media, says 'Kill me so story is over'
113.article_body: The prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, collapsed while speaking to the media on Saturday, saying, "Hurt me, please kill me so that the story will get over." This comes after police registered a case against her lawyer over a Facebook post that allegedly hurt religious sentiments. Earlier, she alleged CM Pinarayi Vijayan's involvement in the case.

114.title: Hardik Pandya is going to be the game-changer for India: Gavaskar
114.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Hardik Pandya will be a game-changer for Team India, in not just the T20 World Cup, but in every T20I match India play. Gavaskar added that the all-round package in Hardik gives Team India options in selection. "Having him as a full-blown all-rounder is a key to the balance of India's team," Gavaskar stated.

115.title: Pune police bust prostitution racket run from spa; 4 girls rescued
115.article_body: Six people were arrested and four girls were rescued after police busted a prostitution racket following a raid at a spa in Pune's Koregaon Park. The spa allegedly ran the prostitution racket by charging customers more money for "extra services", according to the police. The raid was conducted on June 9, based on a tip-off received by the police.

116.title: 7 bodies found after helicopter crashes in Italy
116.article_body: The bodies of seven people were found two days after the helicopter they flew in crashed in Italy. The deceased included four Turkish, two Lebanese nationals and an Italian pilot. The helicopter took off from Lucca in Tuscany on Thursday and was headed to Treviso city. It reportedly got caught up in a storm and disappeared from the radar screens.

117.title: SL break world record against Australia, chase down most runs in final 3 overs of a T20
117.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Australia by four wickets after chasing down 177-run target in third T20I in Pallekele. During their chase, Sri Lanka broke the world record for successfully chasing down most runs in final three overs of a T20. Sri Lanka chased down 59 runs in the last three overs, breaking Sydney Sixers' record of 56 runs against Sydney Thunder.

118.title: Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal' has larger-than-life visuals: Producer
118.article_body: Producer Murad Khetani, speaking about Ranbir Kapoor's 'Animal', has said, "It's a challenging film." However, added that they have a "great team". "Sandeep Reddy Vanga (director) has written the story...he narrated it to Ranbir and Anil Kapoor, they liked it and agreed to come on board," he added. He added the film has action, emotion, heroism and "larger-than-life visuals".

119.title: IAS officer shares Class 10 marksheet of DM in Gujarat, says 'Got only passing marks'
119.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Saran took to Twitter to share Class 10 marksheet of Collector and DM of Gujarat's Bharuch district, saying "He got only passing marks in Class 10." Saran added, "He got 35 marks in English, 36 in Mathematics and 38 in Science...Not only in whole village but in his school it was said that he cannot do anything."

120.title: 318/4 reasons why I wouldn't think bowling first vs NZ wasn't right: Vaughan
120.article_body: Criticising England's fast bowling coach Jon Lewis for saying they took the right call in bowling first against New Zealand in the ongoing second Test, Vaughan tweeted, "318/4 reasons why I wouldn't think that's possibly correct." NZ had ended Day 1 at 318/4 before bundling out for 553 in their first innings. "We took the aggressive option," Lewis had said.

121.title: Delhi Police arrest 2 people in connection with Friday's Jama Masjid protest
121.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested two people under section 153A of IPC in connection with the protest that was held at Jama Masjid on Friday over remarks on Prophet made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and expelled leader Naveen Jindal. "The way people came after offering namaz...with banners and placards...denotes that...there is some kind of planning behind it," police said.

122.title: Assam-based news channel's YouTube account hacked; Pak flag broadcast
122.article_body: Assam-based digital news channel 'TIME8' has said in a press release on Saturday that its YouTube account was hacked by a Pakistan-based group called 'Revolution PK' during a live stream. During the live stream, the Pakistan flag was broadcast along with 'Respect Holy Prophet (PBUH)' tickers, the press release stated. Reportedly, a hymn was also run in the background.

123.title: Starbucks CEO urges staff to return to office, says 'I'll get on my knees'
123.article_body: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz at an event said that his employees are not coming back to the office "at the level" he wants. Schultz said, "I have been unsuccessful, despite everything I've tried to do, to get our people back to work…I've pleaded with them. I said I'll get on my knees. I'll do push-ups. Whatever you want. Come back."

124.title: RBL Bank appoints R Subramaniakumar as its new MD & CEO
124.article_body: RBL Bank has appointed R Subramaniakumar as its new MD and CEO for a period of three years. This comes nearly six months after RBL Bank's MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja stepped down. Subramaniakumar began his banking career with the state-run Punjab National Bank in 1980 and has previously served as administrator of Dewan Housing Finance Corporation Limited (DHFL).

125.title: Kerala CM should resign, face probe: Muraleedharan on gold smuggling case
125.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan said Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan should resign and face the investigation, "if he has some morality left". His statement came following the allegation of CM's involvement in the Kerala gold smuggling case. "For the first time in history of this country, the CM has been accused of such a serious allegation of smuggling (gold)," Muraleedharan added.

126.title: Protest in Telangana's Adilabad over social media post, police use lathicharge
126.article_body: A protest reportedly erupted over a social media post in Telangana's Adilabad district. Police said that the accused, whose post triggered the protest, has been arrested. "We've registered a case under relevant sections of the IPC (Indian Penal Code) against one person...for hurting religious sentiments," police added. Reports said that police dispersed the crowd with use of batons.

127.title: BJP ready to use bulldozer model against those disturbing peace in K’taka: CT Ravi
127.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Saturday said that the party is prepared to replicate the "bulldozer model" of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath against those who disturb communal harmony and peace in Karnataka. Furthermore, he said that a few political parties that have lost polls are trying to stir up unrest in the country.

128.title: 2 ragpickers die after entering into sewer in Delhi
128.article_body: Two ragpickers died after they entered a sewage tank in Delhi on Saturday, said police. The victims - 21-year-old Abdul Rehman and 22-year-old Ramzan - had entered the sewer to collect plastic waste. When the two did not come out, a third ragpicker entered the sewer. The two were then dragged out and were found in an unconscious state.

129.title: Rape lawsuit seeking ₹195 crore from Cristiano Ronaldo dismissed by US judge
129.article_body: A US judge has dismissed a 2018 Nevada lawsuit accusing Cristiano Ronaldo of rape in 2009 and requesting the Portuguese footballer pay the alleged victim more than ₹195 crore in damages. The judge said that the alleged victim's lawyer harmed Ronaldo by conducting himself in "bad faith" through repeated use of stolen, privileged documents to prosecute the case.

130.title: India sees over 8,000 new COVID-19 cases for 2nd day, active cases rise to 44,513
130.article_body: India has reported 8,582 COVID-19 cases, 4,435 recoveries, and four deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 8,329 COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 44,513, while the death toll reached 5,24,761.

131.title: First Russian passports handed out to Ukrainians in occupied Kherson: Report
131.article_body: The Russian authorities have reportedly started handing out Russian passports to the Ukrainians living in the occupied city of Kherson for the first time. According to one of Russia's news agencies, 23 Kherson residents received Russian passports at a ceremony on Saturday. Kherson was one of the first cities that Russia conquered in the initial days of the war.

132.title: Man kills estranged wife's live-in partner in Delhi; arrested
132.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Robin, was arrested after he stabbed his estranged wife's live-in partner to death in Delhi, said police. The woman told the police that she was having a marital dispute and had been living with Kunal, the victim, for the last six months. She was going home with Kunal when Robin stabbed him several times, said police.

133.title: Ratan Tata receives honorary doctorate from Maharashtra's HSNC University
133.article_body: Tata Group Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata was presented with the Honorary Doctorate of Literature by Maharashtra's HSNC University, as a mark of appreciation for his contribution to society. The Governor of Maharashtra and the Chancellor of the university Bhagat Singh Koshyari presented the degree to Tata. "This means so much to me," said Tata during his acceptance speech.

134.title: 2 arrested for snatching gold chains from Gurugram's morning walkers
134.article_body: Two snatchers, who were part of a six-member gang that allegedly snatched gold chains from Gurugram's morning walkers, were arrested on Friday. The police recovered over 10 gold chains and two motorcycles from the accused's possession. Notably, the gang has over 100 cases registered against them in several areas including the Golf Course Road, Nirvana and Malibu Towne, police said.

135.title: Akshay sir said he's worked with most newcomers, I think I'm the 22nd: Manushi
135.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar said that actor Akshay Kumar told her he has worked with most newcomers in the industry. "So I think I'm the 22nd newcomer that Akshay sir has worked with," she said, adding, "For me, I couldn't have asked for a better launch because somewhere I knew that they [Akshay Kumar and Dr Chadraprakash Dwivedi] were so experienced."

136.title: India needs President who can protect Constitution: Congress
136.article_body: The Congress party is of the opinion that India needs a person as President who can protect the Constitution, our institutions and citizenry from the ongoing "onslaught" by the ruling party, Congress said. The statement comes as West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called a meeting of the Opposition leaders, ahead of the election for the next President of India.

137.title: Pune Metro's revenue dips after 3 months as ridership falls
137.article_body: Pune Metro's revenue saw a decline in May as compared to March when the two lines - Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation to Phugewadi and Vanaz to Garware College - had started. While the revenue in March was ₹76,43,500, it was only ₹27,97,146 in May. The ridership number had surged massively after its launch on March 6, said an official.

138.title: B'luru's Singanayakanahalli lake project 'stalled' after criticism: Report
138.article_body: The forest department and the minor irrigation department have apparently stopped pursuing the development project of Bengaluru's Singanayakanahalli lake, The Indian Express reported. Last year, the authorities proposed to axe around 6,316 trees for the project. A senior forest official told The Indian Express, "There was a huge public outcry over axing trees. The project has stalled as of now."

139.title: Ex-Punjab MLA suffers ₹10 lakh loss as robbers steal 10 buffaloes from farm
139.article_body: Former Punjab MLA Tarsem Jodhan said that he has suffered a loss of ₹10 lakh as robbers stole 10 buffaloes from his farm. "They held my workers captive, while they loaded the stolen buffaloes in a vehicle," Jodhan said. A case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code has been registered against the accused, police said.

140.title: Pant is a young captain, he'll improve as series progresses: Bhuvneshwar
140.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's captaincy after India's defeat in the first T20I against South Africa, pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said, "The captain is as good as the team and it's a team effort." He added, "Pant is a young captain and it was his first match. I'm sure he will try to do better and improve as the series progresses."

141.title: B'luru's Idgah Maidan should be preserved as public property: Hindu activist
141.article_body: Hindu activists have reportedly objected to Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan "being treated as property of minorities". Reports said Hindu organisations have decided to celebrate Yoga Day and Independence Day on site. "We will demand from CM Bommai...Idgah Maidan should be preserved as....public property and cultural activities of all religions must be permitted," Hindu activist, Pathapat Srinivas, said.

142.title: Wasn't what my role was supposed to be: Shilpa Shetty on 'Hungama 2'
142.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty said 'Hungama 2' wasn't supposed to be her comeback film. "I said yes to it because I can never say no to Ratan Jain (producer). He introduced...me in the industry," she stated. She added she always wanted to work with filmmaker Priyadarshan. "I saw the film and...felt...this wasn't what my role was supposed to be," she stated.

143.title: Bodies of 2 missing youths found in Pune's Vishrantwadi lake
143.article_body: The bodies of two missing youths, both aged 20, were recovered after villagers found them floating in Pune's Vishrantwadi lake, police officials said. "The youths were missing from June 6 and were found dead on Friday," investigators said. The deceased's families were called after the bodies were identified, following which the bodies were taken for post-mortem, according to police.

144.title: After 5 deaths, officials say K'taka filtration unit not cleaned for 5 yrs
144.article_body: As five people died after drinking contaminated water in Karnataka's Raichur, officials reportedly admitted several wards in city get untreated water. Reports said that officials admitted the filtration unit had not been cleaned or maintained for past five years. Raichur City Municipal Council Commissioner said junior engineer and assistant executive engineer have been suspended in the case.

145.title: Massive fire breaks out in Delhi's Gaffar market, 39 fire engines rushed to spot
145.article_body: A massive fire broke out in the Gaffar market in Delhi on Sunday. "A serious fire call was received from a shoe market in Gaffar, Karol Bagh, at 4:16 am and 39 fire tenders were rushed to the site," Delhi Fire Service Director Atul Garg said. The fire is under control and no one is trapped or injured, ANI reported.

146.title: Who are the 7 final bidders for ₹60,000-crore IPL broadcast rights?
146.article_body: The e-auction for IPL media rights for the next five-year cycle (2023 to 2027) will take place today. Disney-Star, Sony, Viacom-Reliance, Zee, Fun Asia, Super Sport and Times Internet are in the running. The number of bidders this time is half that of the previous auction. The cost to acquire the rights is estimated to be up to ₹60,000 crore.

147.title: 2 AirAsia Delhi-Srinagar flights face technical issues within hrs of each other
147.article_body: AirAsia India's two aircraft on Delhi to Srinagar route returned to the national capital after facing technical issues mid-air on the same day. While one flight took off from Delhi around 11.55 am, the technical issue was informed to passengers mid-air, half an hour later. The substitute aircraft also developed a similar issue and returned to Delhi around 5.30 pm.

148.title: 1 killed, 2 injured as under-construction building falls in Pune
148.article_body: A labourer was killed and two others were injured after an under-construction building collapsed in Pune's Kiwale village. The deceased labourer has been identified as 26-year-old Sandeep Balsingh from Jharkhand. "The construction workers were working at a site around 30 feet deep inside for a basement construction when a part of huge debris suddenly fell on them," said police.

149.title: I don't think we'll see Umran Malik playing in 2nd T20I vs SA: Jaffer
149.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said it's unlikely that pacer Umran Malik will make his India debut in the second T20I against South Africa. "It would be unfair to change the team after one game...Since it's a five-game series, there are always chances of getting opportunities later," he stated. India lost the first T20I by seven wickets.

150.title: Competed with Salman for 'Maine...', discussions were on to launch me: Deepak
150.article_body: Actor-Director Deepak Tijori said he and actor Salman Khan had auditioned for role of 'Prem' in the movie 'Maine Pyar Kia'. "Salman and I were only...people who were competing for the role of Prem, neck-to-neck...They had even told me that if they selected me...they'd like to change my name on...screen and discussed how they'd like to launch me," Tijori added.

151.title: Shaan said 'Don't come in big cars, come in autos, people will give work': Mika
151.article_body: Singer Mika Singh said that when he was new, singer Shaan had told him to not come in big cars "because one doesn't get work". "[He said] 'You simply come in autos...people will give you work'. I thought I had to change things...That a singer shouldn't only be seen in singing shows but should get opportunities everywhere," Mika added.

152.title: BJP will be in Guinness Book for paper leaks: Kejriwal in Himachal
152.article_body: Addressing a gathering at Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The BJP government will be in the Guinness Book of World Records for paper leaks...during its rule." Kejriwal said, "I don't understand why papers are being leaked in Gujarat, Haryana and Himachal." He added, "Why doesn't it happen in our Delhi?"

153.title: We don't need Nupur Sharma's apology: Owaisi on Prophet remark row
153.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said there is no need to seek an apology from Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad since an FIR has been filed against her. "Law will take its own course," Owaisi said. Criticising Jharkhand's government over violence on Friday, he said, "There was firing on people in Ranchi, this shouldn't have happened."

154.title: Nadda meets envoys of 13 countries as part of 'Know BJP' initiative
154.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda interacted with envoys of 13 countries at the party headquarters in Delhi, where he informed them about the party's ideology, history and ongoing activities. This is the fourth such event held by the BJP President. The interaction was a part of the 'Know BJP' initiative which was launched on BJP's foundation day on April 6.

155.title: Strict action must be taken against hatemongers: Sachin Pilot
155.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said strict action must be taken against those spreading hate in society. Reacting to comments over Prophet Muhammad, he said that the Centre wasn't bothered when people of the country demanded action against the spokesperson but was prompt in doing so when foreign countries issued denunciations. Pilot also criticised the Centre over rising inflation and unemployment.

156.title: 30 Army personnel named in chargesheet filed over death of civilians in Nagaland
156.article_body: Thirty Indian Army personnel have been named in the chargesheet filed in the connection to the botched security operation in Nagaland's Mon that led to the death of 13 civilians in December 2021. The personnel belonging to 21 Para Special Forces didn't follow the SOP and the Rules of Engagement and resorted to "indiscriminate and disproportionate firing", an SIT alleged.

157.title: Depp's fans criticise Amber for flying in private jet after lawyer said she can't pay $10mn
157.article_body: Actress Amber Heard was spotted for the first time since the verdict was announced in Johnny Depp's defamation trial. She was clicked stepping out of a private airplane. "If you can afford that, you can afford to pay what you owe Johnny," a tweet read. Her attorney had said she "absolutely cannot" pay the $10 million she owes Johnny now.

158.title: Sitharaman inaugurates GST museum installed in 400-yr-old building in Goa
158.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday inaugurated 'Dharohar', the National Museum of Customs and GST in Goa. The two-storey building is over 400 years old. It showcases artefacts seized by Indian Customs, including the manuscript of Ain-i-Akbari and replica of Amin pillars. It houses the 'Battle of Wits' gallery, showcasing the cerebral battle between smugglers and Customs officers.

159.title: Past decade saw increase in number of women voters: Book
159.article_body: The number of women voters in India has increased over the past decade, according to a new book released. Till 2010, the number of women voters was less than men, Sanjay Kumar, who edited Women Voters in Indian Elections - Changing Trends and Emerging Patterns, said. In 2019 general election, men and women voted in nearly equal numbers, he added.

160.title: World's smallest singer performs at AR Rahman's daughter's wedding reception
160.article_body: A video has shown music composer AR Rahman listening to the world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik performing 'Papa Kehte Hain' at the former's daughter's wedding reception. The video was shared by the Tajik singer on his Instagram page with the caption "Godfather". The reception for Rahman's daughter Khatija and son-in-law Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed was held in Chennai on Friday.

161.title: Indian startup FarEye fires 250 workers globally ahead of appraisal: Report
161.article_body: Indian logistics startup FarEye has laid off as many as 250 employees globally ahead of their appraisal, as per reports. The startup's Co-Founder and CEO Kushal Nahata cited the "softness in market conditions" as the reason behind this move. In 2021, Nahata said FarEye aimed to become a unicorn in 6-12 months after raising $100 million in series E funding.

162.title: Contain Tamil Nadu's COVID-19 spread: CM MK Stalin tells officials
162.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday said measures should be taken to contain the spread of coronavirus in the state and facilities to treat affected patients should be kept ready, in view of rising cases. Stalin, who chaired a meeting to review the COVID-19 situation, advised various departments and local administration to join hands in containing the COVID-19 spread.

163.title: 42-year-old man kills sister over property dispute in Ahmedabad
163.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Madan Singh, allegedly stabbed his younger sister to death over a property dispute in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday. Police said the incident occurred around 2 am when Madan Singh stabbed his sister and injured his father and nephew when they tried to prevent him. A murder case has been filed against Singh, who is currently absconding.

164.title: 2 terrorists killed in separate encounters in J&K's Kulgam, Pulwama
164.article_body: Two terrorists were killed in two separate encounters with security forces in J&K's Kulgam and Pulwama districts on Saturday, police said. Arms and ammunition, including a rifle along with 23 rounds and a hand grenade, were recovered from the encounter site in Kulgam, an official said. The terrorist killed in Kulgam belonged to Hizbul Mujahideen terror outfit, the official added.

165.title: With 4 games remaining, we've chance to win series vs SA: Bhuvneshwar
165.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second T20I, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said with four matches remaining, his side has a chance to win the five-match series. "We've to bowl better and we need to bat in the same fashion as the previous game," he added. Match will be played in Cuttack on Sunday. India trail South Africa 0-1 in ongoing series.

166.title: Home Minister Shah seeks early probe of rape, sexual assault cases
166.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday sought an early investigation of rape and sexual assault cases against women and children, according to an official. Shah also sought stringent punishment against the offenders in a time-bound manner, the official said. Shah made the comments at the 25th meeting of the Western Zonal Council in Diu.

167.title: 3 killed, 1 injured after being hit by train in UP's Prayagraj
167.article_body: Three persons were killed and another person was injured after being hit by a train at Shankargarh railway station in Prayagraj, an official said. Some passengers got down on the other side of the platform and while returning, they were hit by the Chambal Express, the official said. It is yet to be known why they got off the train.

168.title: Bride's sister killed, 10 injured in firing at UP wedding function
168.article_body: The 35-year-old sister of a bride was killed and 10 persons were injured when gunshots were fired during a quarrel at a wedding function in Uttar Pradesh's Etah on Saturday. "An argument broke out between the family members of the bride and some villagers over applying colours," SP Etah said. He added that some suspects have been detained for questioning.

169.title: He might play at Wimbledon: Toni after nephew Nadal's foot treatment
169.article_body: Rafael Nadal's uncle Toni Nadal revealed that his nephew has been feeling "much better" after the foot treatment and wants to train. "And if he has a little chance, he'll play at Wimbledon. He goes on the court on Monday," he added. Days after his record-extending 14th French Open win, Nadal began treatment for his chronic foot problem in Barcelona.

170.title: Hate and unrest not our way, says Rahul Gandhi
170.article_body: A day after the outbreak of violence during protests over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted, "Hate and unrest isn't our way." "Our country has always set an example of truth, non-violence and brotherhood before the world," he said. "It's the responsibility of all...people...to unite India and maintain mutual goodwill," he added.

171.title: It could be society ending: Bill Gates on another virus with 5% fatality rate
171.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said the emergence of another virus with similar virulence to COVID-19 but with 5% fatality rate could be "society ending". He said the world got "lucky" that the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%. "Given the toll of this pandemic...20 million dead globally, a million in the US...it could've been way more fatal," Gates claimed.

172.title: Indian crypto investors got lucky due to tax announcement in Feb: Zerodha CEO
172.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath on Saturday said many Indian cryptocurrency investors "accidentally got lucky" due to announcement of TDS and tax on crypto during the Budget in February. If not for the announcement, "many could've potentially been trapped trying to buy the dip and then averaging down", Kamath said. The government had announced 30% tax on income from digital assets.

173.title: Nayanthara-Vignesh Shivan get notice for violating Tirupati temple rules, apologise
173.article_body: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan, who visited Tirupati temple after their wedding, received notices for wearing footwear inside the temple and doing photoshoots. "In the commotion, we failed to notice we were walking with shoes...We apologise," the couple said. "We've been to Tirupati five times in...last month with the desire to get married...Due to various reasons, it wasn't possible," they added.

174.title: India will definitely bounce back in 2nd T20I: SA all-rounder Parnell
174.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Wayne Parnell said the side's second T20I against India in Cuttack will be crucial, adding the hosts will definitely bounce back. "They're a quality side; we don't expect anything less...every single game till Bengaluru is going to be tough," he added. South Africa are currently leading 1-0 in five-match series. Second T20I will be played on Sunday.

175.title: Development works not done to win elections, says PM Modi in Gujarat
175.article_body: During his visit to Gujarat on Friday, PM Narendra Modi said that his government's development projects are not undertaken to win elections but for the good of the people. It is the "people who make us win elections", he added. Notably, PM Modi laid foundation stones, inaugurated and dedicated projects worth ₹3,050 crore during his day-long visit to the state.

176.title: Team India trains in packed stadium in Cuttack, BCCI shares pics
