349.article_body: Custodial deaths show that the police are becoming mad, Madras High Court on Friday said. "They organise gangs in the name of police. They involve in land grabbing, rape, custodial deaths...all such acts should be checked for good governance," it added. The Police Complaints Authority must be headed by a retired judge of the High Court, Madras HC further said.

350.title: 35-yr-old man held for molesting woman at railway station in Mumbai
350.article_body: A 35-year-old man from Madhya Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly touching a woman inappropriately and trying to kiss her forcibly at Khar railway station in Mumbai. The incident took place on Thursday when the woman was waiting for a train, an official said. Notably, this is the second incident wherein a woman was molested on the Western Railway network.

351.title: BJP wins 3 seats in Maha Rajya Sabha elections; Shiv Sena, Cong, NCP 1 each
351.article_body: BJP has won three out of the six seats in Maharashtra Rajya Sabha elections, while Shiv Sena, Congress and NCP have won one seat each. All three BJP candidates, Piyush Goyal, Anil Bonde and Dhananjay Mahadik won. From the Maha Vikas Aghadi coalition, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut, Congress' Imran Pratapgarhi and NCP's Praful Patel won the remaining three seats.

352.title: Nadal's tennis much more entertaining than Federer: Ex-world no. 1 Mats
352.article_body: Ex-world number one Mats Wilander said Rafael Nadal's tennis is "much more" entertaining than Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic's gameplay. "With Federer, everything seems easy. It's simple and aesthetic. Nadal is different: his true personality arises when the racquet hits the ball," added Mats. "Previously, there was a repetitive aspect to Nadal's game...Now he creates uncertainty," stated Mats.

353.title: Minor girl sexually assaulted by neighbour in Hyd, accused arrested
353.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a man for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl, repeatedly for the last three days. According to police, the accused lives near the victim's house and had called her on the pretext of fetching him cigarettes from a nearby shop. He then took the victim inside his house and sexually assaulted her, police added.

354.title: Bolivian court finds ex-Prez Anez guilty of coup, jailed for 10 yrs
354.article_body: A Bolivian court has found ex-President Jeanine Anez guilty of orchestrating a coup that brought her to power in 2019. She has been sentenced to 10 years in prison. She'd come to power in 2019 after ex-President Evo Morales resigned following mass protests over a disputed election in which he claimed to win a controversial fourth consecutive term in office.

355.title: Karnataka makes face masks mandatory in public places amid rising COVID-19 cases
355.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, the Karnataka government on Friday issued fresh COVID-19 guidelines. It has now made the wearing of face masks mandatory in malls, closed-door events, hotels, pubs, restaurants, educational institutions, cafeterias, factories, offices, hostels and public transport. Karnataka on Friday reported 525 new COVID-19 cases with 494 cases in Bengaluru alone.

356.title: Meta probing Sheryl for using company resources to plan wedding, write her book: Report
356.article_body: Meta is investigating outgoing COO Sheryl Sandberg's use of company resources over several years, as per a report. Sheryl reportedly had her subordinates help write her book and promote her foundation on company time. She is also being probed for using company resources for her upcoming wedding, however, the report said it was a small part of the investigation.

357.title: Bengaluru police remove political banner on road sign, share pics
357.article_body: Following a complaint by a Twitter user over a political banner being put up on a road sign, Bengaluru's Malleshwaram traffic police on Friday tweeted that it has removed the banner. The traffic police also shared pictures of the same. "Flex banners have mushroomed across the city, with political functionaries using them for their 'Advertisement'," the Twitter user had said.

358.title: Britney Spears shares pics from her wedding with Sam Asghari, says 'I had a panic attack'
358.article_body: Singer Britney Spears shared video and pictures from her wedding with Sam Asghari. "It was the most spectacular day! I was so nervous all morning but then at 2:00 pm it really hit me...We're getting married! I had a panic attack and then got it together," she wrote on Instagram. She added, "So many incredible people came...I'm still in shock."

359.title: What is Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, rare condition that paralysed half of Justin Bieber's face?
359.article_body: Justin Bieber revealed he has been diagnosed with Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, which has paralysed half of his face. The syndrome is a neurological condition caused by varicella zoster virus. It occurs when a shingles outbreak affects facial nerve near one ear. Its symptoms include, severe pain in ear, painful rash on eardrum and weakness on one side of the face.

360.title: PMC identifies 16 illegally run schools, warns against admission
360.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) Education Department has identified 16 schools which have been running illegally in the civic body's jurisdiction. "It's a serious issue and our appeal to all the parents would be not to take admission in these schools," the district's deputy director of education said. This is in addition to 27 other illegal schools identified earlier in Pune.

361.title: Justin Bieber reveals he has facial paralysis due to Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, shares video
361.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber took to Instagram to reveal he's suffering from facial paralysis due to Ramsay Hunt Syndrome. "As you can see this eye is not blinking...I can't smile on this side of my face...So there's full paralysis on [right] side of my face," he said in a video. Bieber said he doesn't know how long it'll take to recover.

362.title: Who is Choe Son-hui, North Korea's 1st female Foreign Minister?
362.article_body: North Korea's first female Foreign Minister Choe Son-hui is a veteran diplomat who formerly served as Vice Foreign Minister. Choe served as a close aide to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un during nuclear talks with US and accompanied him to summits with then US President Donald Trump. Choe was tapped to lead the ministry at a meeting overseen by Kim.

363.title: Pakistan to ban govt officials from buying new cars to secure IMF bailout
363.article_body: In a bid to secure IMF bailout money amid its financial crisis, Pakistan will raise taxes on the rich and will impose a ban on government officials from buying new cars. Pakistan will now impose a 2% additional tax on individuals with an annual income of PKR 30 million. The nation will also privatise government assets amid the ongoing crisis.

364.title: Will request Haryana for more water on humanitarian grounds: Delhi CM
364.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that he would request Haryana to release more water on humanitarian grounds. Delhi's water production has fallen by around 100 million gallons per day, Delhi Jal Board (DJB) vice-chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj said. The level of water at Wazirabad pond has dropped from the normal of 674.5 feet to 667.7 feet, Bharadwaj added.

365.title: 120 kg of poppy seized from a truck in J&K's Udhampur
365.article_body: Police seized 120 kg of poppy from a truck on Jammu-Srinagar National Highway in Udhampur district, officials said. During a routine check, a police team intercepted a truck in which a special cabin was detected in a toolbox, inside which five bags of poppy were found, the officials added. The truck driver escaped from the spot, police said.

366.title: 90-year-old unvaccinated woman dies of COVID-19 in MP's Indore
366.article_body: A 90-year-old woman, who had not been vaccinated against COVID-19, died of the infection in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, a health official said. The woman was suffering from high blood pressure and other ailments for a long time. She was admitted to a hospital, where she tested positive for COVID-19 and died on Thursday, the Chief Medical and Health Officer said.

367.title: Sadhguru has shown power of Indian soil to the world: MP CM
367.article_body: Addressing the 'Mitti Bachao Jan-Jagran' programme, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said Isha Foundation founder Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev has shown the power of Indian soil to the world. He added that Madhya Pradesh will work step-by-step in his 'Save Soil' campaign. "Our goal is to strengthen the ecosystem by maintaining the natural balance," Chouhan said.

368.title: 4 men rob Punjab businessman of ₹1 crore cash at gunpoint
368.article_body: Four men entered an office in Punjab's Dera Bassi on the pretext of meeting a property dealer, threatened him at gunpoint and escaped with a bag containing ₹1 crore in cash. Police said the businessman, Harjit Nagpal, sold his ancestral property and had the cash with him. While escaping, the accused shot a food vendor who tried to catch them.

369.title: 22-year-old man arrested for rape & murder of minor in Kota
369.article_body: Police said that a 22-year-old man was arrested for murdering a minor, whose mutilated body was found two days after she went missing from Rajasthan's Kota. The 17-year-old victim had befriended the accused on social media, Kota SP Kesar Singh said. The accused raped the victim and murdered her after she decided to end the relationship with him, Singh added.

370.title: PM Modi meets his 88-year-old former teacher in Gujarat, pic goes viral
370.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday met with his former teacher Jagdish Nayak during his one-day visit to Gujarat. A picture of the PM with 88-year-old Nayak went viral online. "Though it was a short meeting, I do not have words to describe how I felt," said Nayak. "His (PM's) respect and feelings for me have not changed," he added.

371.title: It's wrong to say 4th COVID-19 wave is coming: ICMR official amid case surge
371.article_body: It's not right to say that the fourth wave of COVID-19 is coming in India, ADG of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said on Friday, amid a rise in COVID-19 cases. "We need to examine district-level data. A high number of cases in a few districts can't be considered a uniform increase," said Dr Samiran Panda.

372.title: ED issues fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi for appearance on June 23
372.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued fresh summons to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23 in an alleged money laundering case related to newspaper National Herald, officials said. Earlier this week, Sonia had sought more time from the agency to appear before it as she was still recovering from COVID-19.

373.title: SRK teared up, told NCB 'We've been painted as monsters' after Aryan's arrest: Report
373.article_body: Speaking to India Today, Sanjay Singh, NCB's DDG (operations), revealed Shah Rukh Khan met him and raised concerns about Aryan Khan when he was in custody. "Almost in tears, Shah Rukh...told Sanjay, 'We've been painted as...big criminals or monsters who are out to destroy society'," said India Today. "We find going to work tough every day," he reportedly said.

374.title: Ukraine calls for more weapons from the West to fight Russian forces
374.article_body: Ukraine on Friday sought more help from the West, including quicker deliveries of weapons, to fight the advancing Russian forces. "Everything now depends on what (the West) gives us. Ukraine has one artillery piece to 10 to 15 Russian artillery pieces," a Ukrainian official said. Recently, Russia had warned the West against supplying weapons to Ukraine.

375.title: No, not T20 as yet: Shastri on picking Umran for T20 World Cup
375.article_body: Asked if pacer Umran Malik should be picked in India's squad for T20 World Cup, Ravi Shastri said, "No, not T20 as yet. Groom him. Take him with your team." He added, "If anything, let him start playing white-ball cricket, that's 50-over cricket, maybe even red-ball cricket." Umran wasn't included in India's playing XI for first T20I against South Africa.

376.title: Kerala Cong protests, seeks CM's resignation over gold smuggling
376.article_body: Kerala Congress leaders protested in the state against CM Pinarayi Vijayan and demanded his resignation over the gold smuggling case. "They are trying to threaten the persons who are ready to give evidence against the CM," Kerala Opposition leader VD Satheesan said.  This comes after the prime accused claimed CM, his wife and daughter were involved in the scam.

377.title: BJP office set on fire in WB's Howrah amid protests, internet suspended in district
377.article_body: BJP office in West Bengal's Howrah was set on fire by those protesting against remarks made by two former BJP leaders on Prophet Muhammad. BJP leader Anirban Ganguly shared a video of the vandalised office and sought action against the rioters. Following the incident, internet services were suspended till 6 am on June 13 (Monday).

378.title: 8 men risk having their fingers cut off after being convicted of theft in Iran
378.article_body: Eight Iranian men convicted of theft are in risk of having their fingers on one hand cut off, an NGO warned, decrying the punishment as "inhuman". Authorities have reportedly informed the men that they will be transferred to a prison with a guillotine machine in the coming days. "We call on the international community to urgently intervene," said Amnesty International.

379.title: India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage crosses 194 cr
379.article_body: The Union Health Ministry said that the cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 194.90 crore on Friday. More than 13 lakh coronavirus vaccine doses have been administered till 7 pm today, it added. Notably, over 3.50 crore children in the age group of 12-14 years have been administered the first dose so far.

380.title: No idea: Raducanu on playing Wimbledon after being injured in Nottingham
380.article_body: US Open champion Emma Raducanu said she has "no idea" whether she'll be fit enough to compete at this year's Wimbledon after suffering a "freak" injury in first round at Nottingham Open on Tuesday. The 19-year-old was trailing 4-3 in first set against Switzerland's Viktorija Golubic when she retired with what appeared to be a side strain or rib injury.

381.title: Govt issues new guidelines to curb misleading ads, violators to face ₹10 lakh fine
381.article_body: The government has released new guidelines to prevent false and misleading ads. The new guidelines define 'bait advertisement', 'surrogate advertisement' and 'free claims advertisement'. It lays down provisions regarding ads targeting children and bars Indian and foreigner professionals from endorsing brands. Violation of these guidelines may lead to up to ₹10 lakh penalty for first offence.

382.title: When US sneezes, world catches a cold: Kotak as US inflation hits 40-yr-high
382.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak tweeted, "Let's remember that when US sneezes, the world catches a cold," after US inflation reached 8.6% in May. It's the highest level of inflation recorded in US in over 4 decades as gas, food, and shelter prices continue to surge. "Cannot believe average Fed funds rate still below 1% pa," Kotak further said.

383.title: Quad important for free and open Indo-Pacific: Japanese PM
383.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Friday said that the four-nation Quad grouping of the US, India, Japan and Australia is playing an important role in promoting a free and open Indo-Pacific. Kishida made the comment at a defence conclave in Singapore. Notably, leaders of Quad countries had met for a summit last month in Japan.

384.title: 109 arrested in UP after violent protests over remarks on Prophet
384.article_body: A total of 109 people were arrested on Friday after protests erupted in parts of Uttar Pradesh over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. CM Yogi Adityanath has instructed officials to take "stringent action against anti-social elements". Incidents of stone-pelting and sloganeering were reported, following which police used tear gas and resorted to lathicharge to disperse mobs.

385.title: Concerned about temporary blip in LIC share price: Govt as stock hits record low
385.article_body: The government is "very concerned about the temporary blip in LIC share price", DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said as the state-run insurer's shares hit record low on Friday. Shares of LIC touched all-time low of ₹708.05, wiping out over ₹1.51 lakh crore in investors' wealth since listing. Pandey said that the LIC management will raise the shareholders' value.

386.title: 2 tigers die in a single day in MP's Panna Tiger Reserve
386.article_body: Two tigers died in Madhya Pradesh's Panna Tiger Reserve (PTR) in a single day on Thursday, officials said. "The tiger P-111 was over 13 years old and was suffering from kidney disease...The 10-month-old cub P-234 died in a territorial fight," PTR Field Director Uttam Kumar Sharma said. The body of the cub had scratch marks, officials added.

387.title: Maintain peace: Maha minister amid protest over Prophet remarks
387.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil urged people to maintain peace and cooperate with the police in maintaining law and order. His appeal came after protests erupted in parts of Maharashtra against controversial remarks by a former BJP leader on Prophet Muhammad. Patil said the state government and the Home Department have taken a serious note of Nupur Sharma's remarks.

388.title: S African Prez urges probe into money laundering claims against him
388.article_body: After being accused of money laundering by a former intelligence official, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that the police should be allowed to investigate him. The ex-official claimed that money laundering by Ramaphosa had come to light after robbers stole "millions" from the President's game farm in 2020. Notably, Ramaphosa claimed the money had come from a legitimate source.

389.title: Russia & China open first cross-border road bridge as ties deepen
389.article_body: Russia and China on Friday unveiled the first road bridge between the two countries, according to state media. Notably, this comes amid deepening ties between the two countries in response to tensions with the West over several issues. The bridge links the Russian city of Blagoveshchensk to the Chinese city of Heihe across the Amur river.

390.title: Never imagined my nephew Nadal would win everything he has won: Toni
390.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said he never imagined that his nephew would win everything he has won. "I'm surprised by what Rafa does, that with the pain he has, he's able to think about the ball and not about his foot," he added. Nadal has been dealing with a chronic foot problem.

391.title: LIC stock hits all-time low, wipes off ₹1.5 lakh cr investor wealth since listing
391.article_body: LIC stock hit record lows of ₹708.05 on NSE and ₹708.80 on BSE on Friday, down over 25% from its issue price of ₹949. LIC's market capitalisation fell to ₹4.49 lakh crore at the end of trade on Friday from ₹6 lakh crore, BSE data showed. LIC shareholders lost ₹1.51 lakh crore in less than a month of its listing.

392.title: Mumbai logs 1,956 new COVID-19 cases, highest since Jan; positivity rate at 12.7%
392.article_body: Mumbai on Friday reported 1,956 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily rise in infections since January 23. The daily rise in cases is also nearly 15% higher than the number of cases reported on Thursday. The city reported a positivity rate of 12.7%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 9,191.

393.title: 'My reputation is ruined, did I really deserve it?' Aryan Khan told NCB
393.article_body: Speaking to India Today, Sanjay Singh, NCB's DDG (operations), revealed his conversation with Aryan Khan. As per Sanjay, Aryan told him, "They didn't find any drugs on my person...yet they arrested me. Sir, you've done me great wrong and ruined my reputation." "Why did I have to spend so many weeks in jail- did I really deserve it?" he said.

394.title: Sitharaman & 2 other BJP leaders win in K'taka Rajya Sabha polls, Cong wins 1 seat
394.article_body: Three BJP candidates bagged Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka in polls for the Upper House held on Friday, while the remaining one seat went to a Congress candidate. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Kannada comedian Jaggesh and Karnataka Legislative Council member Lehar Siroya were BJP's winning candidates. Congress' Jairam Ramesh won the remaining seat that went to the polls on Friday.

395.title: 6-time world champion Mary Kom ruled out of Commonwealth Games 2022
395.article_body: India's six-time world champion boxer Mary Kom has been ruled out of Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, the Boxing Federation of India announced. The 39-year-old boxer suffered an injury on the second day of the ongoing CWG trials in Delhi. She twisted her left knee during the Round 1 of her bout against Nitu. Nitu was declared winner of the bout.

396.title: Malaysia to abolish mandatory death penalty: Law Minister
396.article_body: Malaysia's Law Minister has said that the country will abolish the mandatory death penalty and allow judges to set alternative punishments for a range of offences. The Cabinet also agreed to study substitute sentences for all offences carrying the death penalty, the minister added. Notably, over 1,300 people are on death row in Malaysia, with most cases involving drug trafficking.

397.title: Congress wins 3 seats, BJP 1 in Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections
397.article_body: The Congress has won three out of four seats, while BJP has won the remaining one in the Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections. Zee TV Founder and independent candidate Subhash Chandra, who was backed by the BJP, has lost the elections. "Congress' victory in three Rajya Sabha seats in Rajasthan is a victory for democracy," Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot tweeted.

398.title: India's campaign ends after Sindhu crashes out of Indonesia Masters 2022
398.article_body: PV Sindhu has crashed out of 2022 Indonesia Masters Super 500 tournament, ending India's campaign on Friday. Fourth-seeded Sindhu lost to fifth-seeded Ratchanok Intanon 12-21, 10-21 in the women's singles quarter-final. The match lasted 33 minutes. This was Sindhu's fifth straight loss against Intanon. The Indian shuttler is now 4-9 in head-to-head against her Thai opponent.

399.title: Show cause notices to 102 Assam schools over poor Class 10 results
399.article_body: The Assam Secondary Education Department has served show cause notices to 102 schools run by the state government for poor results of their students in the Class 10 examinations. Secondary Education Director Mamata Hojai said the schools' pass percentage was 10% and below. "Out of 102 schools, 25 schools have shown 0% results," Hojai added.

400.title: Sri Lanka could face full-blown humanitarian emergency, says UN
400.article_body: Speaking about the severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the UN on Friday said, "We're concerned that this could develop into a full-blown humanitarian emergency." "The Sri Lankan economy is on the brink of collapse," it added. Sri Lankans have been facing daily blackouts, long queues for petrol and record inflation for the past few months due to the crisis.

401.title: He tried to stay ahead of the game: Smith on Pant's T20I captaincy debut
401.article_body: Praising Rishabh Pant following his captaincy debut for India against South Africa in first T20I, ex-South Africa skipper Graeme Smith said it was a "good night in terms of decision-making" and he'll gain "quite a bit of confidence" from it. "He tried to stay ahead of the game," Smith added. South Africa beat India by seven wickets on Thursday.

402.title: Pictures from Britney Spears' wedding with Sam Asghari surface online
402.article_body: Britney Spears and Sam Asghari tied the knot on Thursday at their Thousand Oaks home in Los Angeles. Photos from their wedding ceremony, which have surfaced online, show her wearing a long white Versace gown. Guests at the wedding included Selena Gomez, Madonna, Drew Barrymore, Paris Hilton, Donatella Versace and Will.i.am.

403.title: We'll strictly blacklist those leaving us for money: Allen Co-founder to educators
403.article_body: Allen Career Institute's Co-founder Brajesh Maheshwari, in a video shared with employees, said the institute will "strictly blacklist" educators who are leaving Allen because of "greed for money". He added, "They should better understand that they will never be allowed to come back to Allen ever." Maheshwari's remarks come after edtech unicorn Unacademy opens its offline centre in Kota.
